00035  *
00036  * lustre/obdclass/llog_swab.c
00037  *
00038  * Swabbing of llog datatypes (from disk or over the wire).
00039  *
00040  * Author: jacob berkman  <jacob@clusterfs.com>
00041  */
00042 
00043 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LOG
00044 
00045 
00046 #include <lustre_log.h>
00047 #include <lustre_update.h>
00048 
00049 static void print_llogd_body(struct llogd_body *d)
00050 {
00051         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "llogd body: %p\n", d);
00052         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_logid.lgl_oi: "DOSTID"\n",
00053                POSTID(&d->lgd_logid.lgl_oi));
00054         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_logid.lgl_ogen: %#x\n", d->lgd_logid.lgl_ogen);
00055         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_ctxt_idx: %#x\n", d->lgd_ctxt_idx);
00056         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_llh_flags: %#x\n", d->lgd_llh_flags);
00057         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_index: %#x\n", d->lgd_index);
00058         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_saved_index: %#x\n", d->lgd_saved_index);
00059         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_len: %#x\n", d->lgd_len);
00060         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlgd_cur_offset: "LPX64"\n", d->lgd_cur_offset);
00061 }
00062 
00063 void lustre_swab_lu_fid(struct lu_fid *fid)
00064 {
00065         __swab64s (&fid->f_seq);
00066         __swab32s (&fid->f_oid);
00067         __swab32s (&fid->f_ver);
00068 }
00069 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_swab_lu_fid);
00070 
00071 void lustre_swab_ost_id(struct ost_id *oid)
00072 {
00073         if (fid_seq_is_mdt0(oid->oi.oi_seq) ||
00074             fid_seq_is_default(oid->oi.oi_seq)) {
00075                 __swab64s(&oid->oi.oi_id);
00076                 __swab64s(&oid->oi.oi_seq);
00077         } else {
00078                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(&oid->oi_fid);
00079         }
00080 }
00081 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_swab_ost_id);
00082 
00083 void lustre_swab_llog_id(struct llog_logid *log_id)
00084 {
00085         __swab64s(&log_id->lgl_oi.oi.oi_id);
00086         __swab64s(&log_id->lgl_oi.oi.oi_seq);
00087         __swab32s(&log_id->lgl_ogen);
00088 }
00089 
00090 void lustre_swab_llogd_body (struct llogd_body *d)
00091 {
00092         ENTRY;
00093         print_llogd_body(d);
00094         lustre_swab_llog_id(&d->lgd_logid);
00095         __swab32s (&d->lgd_ctxt_idx);
00096         __swab32s (&d->lgd_llh_flags);
00097         __swab32s (&d->lgd_index);
00098         __swab32s (&d->lgd_saved_index);
00099         __swab32s (&d->lgd_len);
00100         __swab64s (&d->lgd_cur_offset);
00101         print_llogd_body(d);
00102         EXIT;
00103 }
00104 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_swab_llogd_body);
00105 
00106 void lustre_swab_llogd_conn_body (struct llogd_conn_body *d)
00107 {
00108         __swab64s (&d->lgdc_gen.mnt_cnt);
00109         __swab64s (&d->lgdc_gen.conn_cnt);
00110         lustre_swab_llog_id(&d->lgdc_logid);
00111         __swab32s (&d->lgdc_ctxt_idx);
00112 }
00113 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_swab_llogd_conn_body);
00114 
00115 void lustre_swab_ll_fid(struct ll_fid *fid)
00116 {
00117         __swab64s (&fid->id);
00118         __swab32s (&fid->generation);
00119         __swab32s (&fid->f_type);
00120 }
00121 
00122 void lustre_swab_lu_seq_range(struct lu_seq_range *range)
00123 {
00124         __swab64s (&range->lsr_start);
00125         __swab64s (&range->lsr_end);
00126         __swab32s (&range->lsr_index);
00127         __swab32s (&range->lsr_flags);
00128 }
00129 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_swab_lu_seq_range);
00130 
00131 void lustre_swab_update_ops(struct update_ops *uops, unsigned int op_count)
00132 {
00133         unsigned int i;
00134         unsigned int j;
00135 
00136         for (i = 0; i < op_count; i++) {
00137                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(&uops->uops_op[i].uop_fid);
00138                 __swab16s(&uops->uops_op[i].uop_type);
00139                 __swab16s(&uops->uops_op[i].uop_param_count);
00140                 for (j = 0; j < uops->uops_op[i].uop_param_count; j++)
00141                         __swab16s(&uops->uops_op[i].uop_params_off[j]);
00142         }
00143 }
00144 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_swab_update_ops);
00145 
00146 void lustre_swab_llog_rec(struct llog_rec_hdr *rec)
00147 {
00148         struct llog_rec_tail *tail = NULL;
00149 
00150         __swab32s(&rec->lrh_len);
00151         __swab32s(&rec->lrh_index);
00152         __swab32s(&rec->lrh_type);
00153         __swab32s(&rec->lrh_id);
00154 
00155         switch (rec->lrh_type) {
00156         case OST_SZ_REC:
00157         {
00158                 struct llog_size_change_rec *lsc =
00159                         (struct llog_size_change_rec *)rec;
00160 
00161                 lustre_swab_ll_fid(&lsc->lsc_fid);
00162                 __swab32s(&lsc->lsc_ioepoch);
00163                 tail = &lsc->lsc_tail;
00164                 break;
00165         }
00166         case MDS_UNLINK_REC:
00167         {
00168                 struct llog_unlink_rec *lur = (struct llog_unlink_rec *)rec;
00169 
00170                 __swab64s(&lur->lur_oid);
00171                 __swab32s(&lur->lur_oseq);
00172                 __swab32s(&lur->lur_count);
00173                 tail = &lur->lur_tail;
00174                 break;
00175         }
00176         case MDS_UNLINK64_REC:
00177         {
00178                 struct llog_unlink64_rec *lur =
00179                         (struct llog_unlink64_rec *)rec;
00180 
00181                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(&lur->lur_fid);
00182                 __swab32s(&lur->lur_count);
00183                 tail = &lur->lur_tail;
00184                 break;
00185         }
00186         case CHANGELOG_REC:
00187         {
00188                 struct llog_changelog_rec *cr =
00189                         (struct llog_changelog_rec *)rec;
00190 
00191                 __swab16s(&cr->cr.cr_namelen);
00192                 __swab16s(&cr->cr.cr_flags);
00193                 __swab32s(&cr->cr.cr_type);
00194                 __swab64s(&cr->cr.cr_index);
00195                 __swab64s(&cr->cr.cr_prev);
00196                 __swab64s(&cr->cr.cr_time);
00197                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(&cr->cr.cr_tfid);
00198                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(&cr->cr.cr_pfid);
00199                 if (cr->cr.cr_flags & CLF_RENAME) {
00200                         struct changelog_ext_rename *rnm =
00201                                 changelog_rec_rename(&cr->cr);
00202 
00203                         lustre_swab_lu_fid(&rnm->cr_sfid);
00204                         lustre_swab_lu_fid(&rnm->cr_spfid);
00205                 }
00206                 /* Because the tail follows a variable-length structure we need
00207                  * to compute its location at runtime */
00208                 tail = (struct llog_rec_tail *)((char *)&cr->cr +
00209                                                 changelog_rec_size(&cr->cr) +
00210                                                 cr->cr.cr_namelen);
00211                 break;
00212         }
00213 
00214         case CHANGELOG_USER_REC:
00215         {
00216                 struct llog_changelog_user_rec *cur =
00217                         (struct llog_changelog_user_rec*)rec;
00218 
00219                 __swab32s(&cur->cur_id);
00220                 __swab64s(&cur->cur_endrec);
00221                 tail = &cur->cur_tail;
00222                 break;
00223         }
00224 
00225         case HSM_AGENT_REC: {
00226                 struct llog_agent_req_rec *arr =
00227                         (struct llog_agent_req_rec *)rec;
00228 
00229                 __swab32s(&arr->arr_hai.hai_len);
00230                 __swab32s(&arr->arr_hai.hai_action);
00231                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(&arr->arr_hai.hai_fid);
00232                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(&arr->arr_hai.hai_dfid);
00233                 __swab64s(&arr->arr_hai.hai_cookie);
00234                 __swab64s(&arr->arr_hai.hai_extent.offset);
00235                 __swab64s(&arr->arr_hai.hai_extent.length);
00236                 __swab64s(&arr->arr_hai.hai_gid);
00237                 /* no swabing for opaque data */
00238                 /* hai_data[0]; */
00239                 break;
00240         }
00241 
00242         case MDS_SETATTR64_REC:
00243         {
00244                 struct llog_setattr64_rec *lsr =
00245                         (struct llog_setattr64_rec *)rec;
00246 
00247                 lustre_swab_ost_id(&lsr->lsr_oi);
00248                 __swab32s(&lsr->lsr_uid);
00249                 __swab32s(&lsr->lsr_uid_h);
00250                 __swab32s(&lsr->lsr_gid);
00251                 __swab32s(&lsr->lsr_gid_h);
00252                 __swab64s(&lsr->lsr_valid);
00253                 tail = &lsr->lsr_tail;
00254                 break;
00255         }
00256         case OBD_CFG_REC:
00257                 /* these are swabbed as they are consumed */
00258                 break;
00259         case LLOG_HDR_MAGIC:
00260         {
00261                 struct llog_log_hdr *llh = (struct llog_log_hdr *)rec;
00262 
00263                 __swab64s(&llh->llh_timestamp);
00264                 __swab32s(&llh->llh_count);
00265                 __swab32s(&llh->llh_bitmap_offset);
00266                 __swab32s(&llh->llh_flags);
00267                 __swab32s(&llh->llh_size);
00268                 __swab32s(&llh->llh_cat_idx);
00269                 tail = LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh);
00270                 break;
00271         }
00272         case LLOG_LOGID_MAGIC:
00273         {
00274                 struct llog_logid_rec *lid = (struct llog_logid_rec *)rec;
00275 
00276                 lustre_swab_llog_id(&lid->lid_id);
00277                 tail = &lid->lid_tail;
00278                 break;
00279         }
00280         case LLOG_GEN_REC:
00281         {
00282                 struct llog_gen_rec *lgr = (struct llog_gen_rec *)rec;
00283 
00284                 __swab64s(&lgr->lgr_gen.mnt_cnt);
00285                 __swab64s(&lgr->lgr_gen.conn_cnt);
00286                 tail = &lgr->lgr_tail;
00287                 break;
00288         }
00289         case LLOG_PAD_MAGIC:
00290                 break;
00291         case UPDATE_REC:
00292         {
00293                 struct llog_update_record *lur =
00294                                 (struct llog_update_record *)rec;
00295                 struct update_records *record = &lur->lur_update_rec;
00296 
00297                 __swab32s(&record->ur_flags);
00298                 __swab64s(&record->ur_batchid);
00299                 __swab64s(&record->ur_master_transno);
00300                 __swab32s(&record->ur_param_count);
00301                 __swab32s(&record->ur_update_count);
00302                 lustre_swab_update_ops(&record->ur_ops,
00303                                        record->ur_update_count);
00304 
00305                 /* Compute tail location. */
00306                 tail = (struct llog_rec_tail *)((char *)record +
00307                                                 update_records_size(record));
00308                 break;
00309         }
00310         default:
00311                 CERROR("Unknown llog rec type %#x swabbing rec %p\n",
00312                        rec->lrh_type, rec);
00313         }
00314 
00315         if (tail) {
00316                 __swab32s(&tail->lrt_len);
00317                 __swab32s(&tail->lrt_index);
00318         }
00319 }
00320 
00321 static void print_llog_hdr(struct llog_log_hdr *h)
00322 {
00323         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "llog header: %p\n", h);
00324         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_hdr.lrh_index: %#x\n", h->llh_hdr.lrh_index);
00325         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_hdr.lrh_len: %#x\n", h->llh_hdr.lrh_len);
00326         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_hdr.lrh_type: %#x\n", h->llh_hdr.lrh_type);
00327         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_timestamp: "LPX64"\n", h->llh_timestamp);
00328         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_count: %#x\n", h->llh_count);
00329         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_bitmap_offset: %#x\n", h->llh_bitmap_offset);
00330         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_flags: %#x\n", h->llh_flags);
00331         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_size: %#x\n", h->llh_size);
00332         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_cat_idx: %#x\n", h->llh_cat_idx);
00333         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_tail.lrt_index: %#x\n",
00334                LLOG_HDR_TAIL(h)->lrt_index);
00335         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tllh_tail.lrt_len: %#x\n",
00336                LLOG_HDR_TAIL(h)->lrt_len);
00337 }
00338 
00339 void lustre_swab_llog_hdr (struct llog_log_hdr *h)
00340 {
00341         ENTRY;
00342         print_llog_hdr(h);
00343 
00344         lustre_swab_llog_rec(&h->llh_hdr);
00345 
00346         print_llog_hdr(h);
00347         EXIT;
00348 }
00349 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_swab_llog_hdr);
00350 
00351 static void print_lustre_cfg(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00352 {
00353         int i;
00354         ENTRY;
00355 
00356         if (!(libcfs_debug & D_OTHER)) /* don't loop on nothing */
00357                 return;
00358         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "lustre_cfg: %p\n", lcfg);
00359         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlcfg->lcfg_version: %#x\n", lcfg->lcfg_version);
00360 
00361         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlcfg->lcfg_command: %#x\n", lcfg->lcfg_command);
00362         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlcfg->lcfg_num: %#x\n", lcfg->lcfg_num);
00363         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlcfg->lcfg_flags: %#x\n", lcfg->lcfg_flags);
00364         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlcfg->lcfg_nid: %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(lcfg->lcfg_nid));
00365 
00366         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlcfg->lcfg_bufcount: %d\n", lcfg->lcfg_bufcount);
00367         if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount < LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT)
00368                 for (i = 0; i < lcfg->lcfg_bufcount; i++)
00369                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "\tlcfg->lcfg_buflens[%d]: %d\n",
00370                                i, lcfg->lcfg_buflens[i]);
00371         EXIT;
00372 }
00373 
00374 void lustre_swab_lustre_cfg(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00375 {
00376         int i;
00377         ENTRY;
00378 
00379         __swab32s(&lcfg->lcfg_version);
00380 
00381         if (lcfg->lcfg_version != LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION) {
00382                 CERROR("not swabbing lustre_cfg version %#x (expecting %#x)\n",
00383                        lcfg->lcfg_version, LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION);
00384                 EXIT;
00385                 return;
00386         }
00387 
00388         __swab32s(&lcfg->lcfg_command);
00389         __swab32s(&lcfg->lcfg_num);
00390         __swab32s(&lcfg->lcfg_flags);
00391         __swab64s(&lcfg->lcfg_nid);
00392         __swab32s(&lcfg->lcfg_bufcount);
00393         for (i = 0; i < lcfg->lcfg_bufcount && i < LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT; i++)
00394                 __swab32s(&lcfg->lcfg_buflens[i]);
00395 
00396         print_lustre_cfg(lcfg);
00397         EXIT;
00398         return;
00399 }
00400 
00401 /* used only for compatibility with old on-disk cfg_marker data */
00402 struct cfg_marker32 {
00403         __u32   cm_step;
00404         __u32   cm_flags;
00405         __u32   cm_vers;
00406         __u32   padding;
00407         __u32   cm_createtime;
00408         __u32   cm_canceltime;
00409         char    cm_tgtname[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00410         char    cm_comment[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00411 };
00412 
00413 #define MTI_NAMELEN32    (MTI_NAME_MAXLEN - \
00414         (sizeof(struct cfg_marker) - sizeof(struct cfg_marker32)))
00415 
00416 void lustre_swab_cfg_marker(struct cfg_marker *marker, int swab, int size)
00417 {
00418         struct cfg_marker32 *cm32 = (struct cfg_marker32*)marker;
00419         ENTRY;
00420 
00421         if (swab) {
00422                 __swab32s(&marker->cm_step);
00423                 __swab32s(&marker->cm_flags);
00424                 __swab32s(&marker->cm_vers);
00425         }
00426         if (size == sizeof(*cm32)) {
00427                 __u32 createtime, canceltime;
00428                 /* There was a problem with the original declaration of
00429                  * cfg_marker on 32-bit systems because it used time_t as
00430                  * a wire protocol structure, and didn't verify this in
00431                  * wirecheck.  We now have to convert the offsets of the
00432                  * later fields in order to work on 32- and 64-bit systems.
00433                  *
00434                  * Fortunately, the cm_comment field has no functional use
00435                  * so can be sacrificed when converting the timestamp size.
00436                  *
00437                  * Overwrite fields from the end first, so they are not
00438                  * clobbered, and use memmove() instead of memcpy() because
00439                  * the source and target buffers overlap.  bug 16771 */
00440                 createtime = cm32->cm_createtime;
00441                 canceltime = cm32->cm_canceltime;
00442                 memmove(marker->cm_comment, cm32->cm_comment, MTI_NAMELEN32);
00443                 marker->cm_comment[MTI_NAMELEN32 - 1] = '\0';
00444                 memmove(marker->cm_tgtname, cm32->cm_tgtname,
00445                         sizeof(marker->cm_tgtname));
00446                 if (swab) {
00447                         __swab32s(&createtime);
00448                         __swab32s(&canceltime);
00449                 }
00450                 marker->cm_createtime = createtime;
00451                 marker->cm_canceltime = canceltime;
00452                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Find old cfg_marker(Srv32b,Clt64b) "
00453                        "for target %s, converting\n",
00454                        marker->cm_tgtname);
00455         } else if (swab) {
00456                 __swab64s(&marker->cm_createtime);
00457                 __swab64s(&marker->cm_canceltime);
00458         }
00459 
00460         EXIT;
00461         return;
00462 }
